subject: Self Care
title: A Brief History of Meditation
description: A 60-second lesson on A Brief History of Meditation.

hook.text: Cave paintings from 5,000 BCE show humans sitting in meditative postures. This practice is ancient.

buildup.text: Hindu Vedic traditions formalized meditation around 1500 BCE. Buddhism spread it across Asia centuries later.

discovery.text: In the 1960s, transcendental meditation reached the West. The Beatles made it mainstream culture.

twist.text: Modern mindfulness is largely secular. Scientists stripped the spiritual context and studied what remained.

climax.text: From caves to labs, meditation endures because humans have always needed a way to quiet the mind.

punchline.text: Meditation survived 7,000 years. It clearly works.

quiz.question: When did meditation first appear in historical records?
